result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Continue Mental Health Treatment and take all prescribed medications.
- Attend and complete parenting classes.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. **if requested by agent**
-Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Alisha C., without approval of the agent, then No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain GED/ HSED.
-

10/9/2015 STAY LIFTED.  To serve 30 days, straight time.  No good time credit. Order for Commitment signed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Attorney Brian B. Burke in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.    Defendant fails to appear.  Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (30 days straight time).

Defendant Justin Powell in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotaitions and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Continue Mental Health Treatment and 
   take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
   --- if request by agent.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Alisha C., without approval 
  of the agent, then no violent contact.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Community Service 2 to 5 hours weekly.    
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Justin Powell in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn for attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Hon. Jeffrey Kremers for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Due to the unavailability of defense counsel, who is currently in trial in branch 23, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Due to the unavailability of the court on 7-13-2015, Jury Trial rescheduled to Branch 4 on 7-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  Clerk advised both the State and Attorney McGinn of the new trial date of 7-14-2015.   mld

Defendant Justin Powell in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Alisha C., make all court appearances and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Justin Powell in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  911 cd will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Parties are exploring a potential deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Alisha C., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: ALISHA C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justin Powell in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Justin Powell in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
